Yvette Grubman }} '''Elizabeth Grubman''' (born January 30, 1971) is an American publicist, manager and socialite.https://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/11259/index1.html She is the daughter of [[entertainment lawyer]] [[Allen Grubman]] and his first wife, the late Yvette Grubman.[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=990CE5D7153DF931A15753C1A963958260 WEDDINGS; Eric Gatoff and Lizzie Grubman], ''[[The New York Times]]''. Accessed September 10, 2007. In 2002, Grubman served 38 days in jail for an incident where she intentionally backed a Mercedes SUV into a crowd, injuring 16 people.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2004/04/27/nyregion/crash-is-still-haunting-grubman.html | work=The New York Times | first=Michelle | last=O'Donnell | title=Crash Is Still Haunting Grubman | date=April 27, 2004}}{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/10/24/nyregion/grubman-gets-jail-sentence-and-scolding-from-the-judge.html | work=The New York Times | first=Elissa | last=Gootman | title=Grubman Gets Jail Sentence And Scolding From the Judge | date=October 24, 2002}} ==Early life== She is the daughter of [[entertainment lawyer]] [[Allen Grubman]] and his first wife, the late Yvette Grubman. Her parents divorced in 1988.[https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/story?id=103266] Her mother had multiple sclerosis, and died of ovarian cancer at 58 in 2001. ==Career== Grubman is well known as a publicist and manager. She founded her own company in 1996, and has represented [[Britney Spears]], [[Jay-Z]], and the [[Backstreet Boys]].{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2004-04-26-expert-grubman_x.htm|title=Accident expert says Grubman intentionally ran down people in 2001|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|date=April 27, 2004|accessdate=September 10, 2007}} The 2005 reality show ''[[PoweR Girls]]'' on [[MTV]] centered on a group of young publicists working for Grubman's PR firm.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/ontv/dyn/power_girls/series.jhtml|title=Power Girls|publisher=MTV|accessdate=September 10, 2007}}{{cite magazine|last=Sternbergh|first=Adam|url=https://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/11259|title=Lizzie Grubmanâ€™s Star Vehicle|magazine=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=March 7, 2005|accessdate=September 12, 2007}} The title is a reference to a 1998 cover story in ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' magazine that profiled Grubman and several of her rivals, noting that "Lizzie was clearly the most powerful girl of all.".{{cite magazine|url=https://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/5017/index1.html|title=Reversal of Fortune|magazine=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=July 30, 2001|accessdate=September 10, 2007}} ==Personal life== Grubman attended four high schools, including the [[New York City]] [[University-preparatory school|prep school]]s [[Horace Mann School|Horace Mann]], [[The Birch Wathen Lenox School|Lenox]], and [[Dwight School|Dwight]].{{cite news|last=Harris|first=Lynn|url=http://www.salon.com/2003/08/07/grubman_2/|title=Thin Lizzie|work=Salon|date=August 7, 2003|accessdate=January 30, 2012}} She briefly attended [[Northeastern University]], but dropped out before completing her sophomore year. In 1995, she married Eric Gatoff, an associate at her father's law firm. They divorced in 1997.{{cite web|url=http://www.astro.com/astro-databank/Grubman,_Lizzie |title=Astrology: Lizzie Grubman, birth date 30 January 1971, born in New York |publisher=Astro.com |date= |accessdate=October 21, 2013}} === 2001 incident with an SUV === On July 7, 2001, after being asked by security guards to remove her Mercedes from a fire lane, Grubman intentionally drove her father's [[Mercedes Benz]] [[Sport utility vehicle|SUV]]https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/02/fashion/lizzie-grubman-hamptons-publicist.html?smid=fb-nytimes&smtyp=cur&_r=0 into a crowd of people outside of the Conscience Point Inn at 1976 North Sea Road in [[the Hamptons]], injuring 16 people. Grubman was later charged in a 26-count [[indictment]] with [[felony]] crimes including second-degree [[assault]], [[Drunk driving (United States)|driving while intoxicated]], and [[reckless endangerment]].{{cite web|url=http://www.courttv.com/trials/grubman/071702_ctv.html|title=Grubman's gamble: Beat the DWI|publisher=[[Court TV]]|date=July 17, 2002|accessdate=November 24, 2007|quote=Grubman's lawyer, Stephen Scaring, said the defense will focus on disproving the driving while intoxicated charge a grand jury returned last September against the 31-year-old celebrity party organizer.... Grubman was also indicted for felony charges of vehicular assault and second-degree assault}} The subsequent trial garnered widespread media coverage,{{cite magazine|last=Ripley|first=Amanda|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,167589,00.html|title=Rage Of The Hamptons|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=July 15, 2001|accessdate=September 10, 2007}}{{cite news|url=http://topics.nytimes.com/top/reference/timestopics/people/g/elizabeth_s_grubman/index.html?s=oldest&offset=30&|title=Times Topics: Elizabeth S. Grubman|newspaper=The New York Times|accessdate=September 10, 2007 | first=Elissa | last=Gootman}} not only because of the particular circumstances of the crash, but because of what Richard Johnson, editor of the ''[[New York Post]]''{{'}}s [[Page Six]], referred to as "the overreaching drama of class warfare."{{cite news|last=Martin|first=Rick|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9E05EED7153BF936A25754C0A9679C8B63&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all|title=NOTICED; A Publicist Scorched By Fires She Fanned|newspaper=The New York Times|date=July 15, 2001|accessdate=November 24, 2007}} Grubman was alleged to have made an inflammatory statement before striking her victims with her vehicle: "Fuck you, white trash."{{cite web|url=http://www.courttv.com/news/grubman_docs/conlon1.html|publisher=[[Court TV]]|title=Reproduction of State Supreme Court Complaint, filed by the victim Scott Conlon|date=July 16, 2001|accessdate=November 24, 2007|quote=In particular response to the request of the plaintiff, in his capacity as security supervisor at the aforesaid Conscience Point Inn, for the defendant LIZZIE GRUBMAN to move the motor vehicle, the defendant uttered the statement: 'Fuck you, white trash'.}} Later, allegations arose that she received "special treatment"{{cite web|last=Springer|first=John|url=http://www.courttv.com/trials/grubman/070202_ctv.html|title=A year after Hamptons horror, publicity princess could be poised for a plea deal|publisher=[[Court TV]]|date=July 2, 2002|accessdate=November 24, 2007}} at the hands of police, who did not perform a [[Breathalyzer]] test despite allegations, and later, criminal charges, that she was intoxicated at the time of the incident.{{cite web|url=http://www.courttv.com/news/grubman_docs/conlon1.html|publisher=[[Court TV]]|title=Reproduction of State Supreme Court Complaint, filed by the victim Scott Conlon|date=July 16, 2001|accessdate=November 24, 2007}} See page 2, items 10, 11, and 12. In the criminal trial, Grubman faced up to eight years in prison, but served only thirty-eight days in jail and received five years' probation after reaching a plea bargain for leaving the scene of a car accident.{{cite magazine|last=Hamm|first=Liza|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20004256,00.html|title=Lizzie Grubman Gives Birth to Baby Boy|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=December 14, 2006|accessdate=September 10, 2007}} Grubman has said that the SUV incident was an accident.{{cite news|last=Gregorian|first=Dareh|url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/08172007/news/regionalnews/finally__the_last_of_lizzie_regionalnews_dareh_gregorian.htm|title=FINALLY! THE 'LAST' OF LIZZIE|newspaper=[[The New York Post]]|date=August 17, 2007|accessdate=September 10, 2007}} ==References== ;Notes {{Reflist|2}} ;Sources *https://web.archive.org/web/20091206035432/http://gawker.com/5418329/lizzie-grubman-and-erin-kaplan-plot-reality-show-domination-at-pastis *http://www.nypostonline.com/p/pagesix/sightings_fKYBdpnBQxnEVjFi9rZKyH *http://www.nypost.com/p/pagesix/lizzie_hubby_breaking_up_q5yea4ngDQFaNmiGk4MTaL *[https://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/5017/ Profile in New York magazine] ==External links== *{{IMDb name|1122431}} *[http://www.plumtv.com/videos/hamptons-nick-leighton-interviews-publicist-lizzie-grubman-1 Lizzie on Plum TV Part 1 June 2009] Plum TV Video *[http://www.plumtv.com/videos/hamptons-nick-leighton-interviews-publicist-lizzie-grubman-2 Lizzie on Plum TV Part 2 June 2009] Plum TV Video {{DEFAULTSORT:Grubman, Lizzie}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:American marketing people]] [[Category:American people convicted of assault]] [[Category:American public relations people]] [[Category:Marketing women]] [[Category:Birch Wathen Lenox School alumni]]
